results.definition: a decorative texture or appearance of a surface (or the substance that gives it that appearance)
examples: the boat had a metallic finish
he applied a coat of a clear finish
when the finish is too thin it is difficult to apply evenly
when these final episodes are broadcast it will be the finish of the show

results.definition: finish eating all the food on one's plate or on the table
the temporal end; the concluding time
examples: the market was up at the finish

results.definition: a highly developed state of perfection; having a flawless or impeccable quality
examples: almost an inspiration which gives to all work that finish which is almost art

results.definition: have an end, in a temporal, spatial, or quantitative sense; either spatial or metaphorical

examples: his best finish in a major tournament was third
the speaker's finishing was greeted with applause

results.definition: come or bring to a finish or an end
examples: He finished the dishes
The fastest runner finished the race in just over 2 hours; others finished in over 4 hours

results.definition: the place designated as the end (as of a race or journey)
examples: a crowd assembled at the finish

results.definition: cause to finish a relationship with somebody
examples: That finished me with Mary

results.definition: designated event that concludes a contest (especially a race)
examples: excitement grew as the finish neared
my horse was several lengths behind at the finish
the winner is the team with the most points at the finish
The carpenter finished the table beautifully
this shirt is not finished properly

results.definition: the downfall of someone (as of persons on one side of a conflict)
examples: booze will be the finish of him
it was a fight to the finish

results.definition: (wine tasting) the taste of a wine on the back of the tongue (as it is swallowed)
examples: the wine has a nutty flavor and a pleasant finish
